title: Shrimp Quesadillas with Cilantro and Lime

Ingredients.1: 0.25 (16 ounce) jar roasted red peppers, drained and minced

Ingredients.2: 2 tablespoons chopped fresh cilantro, or to taste

Ingredients.5: 8  large shrimp - peeled, deveined, and chopped into bite-sized pieces

Directions.1: Combine roasted red peppers, cilantro, lime juice, and chili powder in a shallow dish. Toss chopped shrimp in the lime mixture. Chill in the refrigerator.

Directions.2: Meanwhile, heat a skillet over medium heat and add olive oil. Saute onion in the hot oil until tender and translucent, about 5 minutes. Add shrimp and lime mixture and saute until shrimp are pink and cooked through, about 3 minutes. Remove mixture from the skillet.

Directions.3: Assemble quesadillas by placing shrimp mixture and Mexican cheese in between 2 tortillas.

Directions.4: Heat tortillas in the skillet over medium-low heat until cheese is melted and tortillas are crispy, 3 to 4 minutes. Cut quesadillas into bite-sized segments and serve.
